thread.title: 7 things to know about today, plus Independent Bankers Bank files for Ch. 11
thread.title_full: 7 things to know about today, plus Independent Bankers Bank files for Ch. 11

author: Cindy Barth
title: 7 things to know about today, plus Independent Bankers Bank files for Ch. 11
text: 7 things to know about today, plus Independent Bankers Bank files for Ch. 11 Jul 1, 2015, 7:14am EDT Enlarge James McKillop III, CEO of Independent Bankers Bank Independent Bankers Bank of Florida in Lake Mary filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection this week in an effort to eliminate or renegotiate $7 million in debt, the Orlando Sentinel reports. Independent Bankers Bank, like many financial institutions during the recent recession, has struggled since many of its customers are banks that also faced difficulties due to holding large amounts of residential loans after the housing market dived. The 30-year-old bank seeks a sale to Baton Rouge-based First National Bankers Bankshares. Home of the Day And check out these other Wednesday headlines as well: DisneyQuest closing at Walt Disney World Just one day after announcing the closure of the Magic of Disney Animation attraction at Disney's Hollywood Studios, Disney on Tuesday confirmed that DisneyQuest , a virtual reality arcade located in Downtown Disney, will close by next year, Theme Park Insider reports. DisneyQuest's space will be taken by the NBA Experience restaurant and attraction i the rebranded Disney Springs shopping and dining district. Read more here . Uber document shows huge growth, deep losses Is Uber’s growth sustainable? The company’s rapid expansion comes at a significant expense to its bottom line, according to new documents which surfaced during the company’s fundraising efforts. The ride-sharing service is telling prospective investors that it saw $470 million in operating losses on $415 million in revenue, according to Bloomberg , citing a document provided to prospective investors. It’s unknown what time period these financial results represent. Read more here . Uber came into the Orlando market last year. Florida Blue recognized for disability inclusion Health insurer Florida Blue scored a perfect 100 on the inaugural Disability Equality Index survey by the American Association of People with Disabilities and the U.S. Business Leadership Network. The score puts Florida Blue in the company of national firms such as AT&T , Starbucks and Procter & Gamble as employers who make an outstanding effort for its employees with disabilities. Florida Blue was among 19 large companies, and one of only two health care companies, to receive a perfect score of 100 points. The insurer has more than 4 million health care members across the state. AT&T extends deadline for DirecTV acquisition AT&T has extended the termination date of the agreement to acquire DirecTV . The short extension will allow it to obtain the final regulatory approval it needs to close the deal, which it expects will close shortly, AT&T (NYSE: T) stated in a document filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on Monday. If the deal closes, as many analysts expect, it will create a pay television company with about 26 million subscribers. Read more here . Trending this morning on Google Business
